intro: Euphrasia stipitata, commonly known as the clustered eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are square and hairy. Euphrasia stipitata is often found in clusters, giving it its common name.
